concept.title: Encrypt zeros AES-key verification algorithm
concept.shortdesc: The cryptographic engine provides a method for verifying the value of an AES cryptographic key or key part without revealing information about the value of the key or key part.

conbody.p: In this method, the AES key data encryption algorithm encodes a 128-bit value that is all zero bits. The leftmost 32 bits of the result are compared to the trial input value or returned from the verb in an 8-byte variable that is padded with bits valued to zero.
